results.title: The Coasts of Clyde
results.creator_credit: British Transport Films, Stewart McAllister and James Ritchie
results.brief_description: A tour of the Firth of Clyde by Bernard Braden, Canadian film and stage actor. Visits to Largs and Dunoon, Rothesay and Loch Lomond; scientists working at a Fishing Research Station, holiday-makers on steamer trips up and down the firth; seals playing around the Kyles of Bute. Finally Braden visits Arran, the island where his grandparents left to sail for the new world.

results.title: The Coastguard
results.creator_credit: R.H.R. Productions, Michael Barden and Simon Campbell-Jones
results.brief_description: The film was made for the 150th anniversary of the founding of H.M. Coastguard. It shows the work carried out by the Coastguard Service in saving life at sea and on the coast, both directly and through their co-ordination with R.A.F. Navy, Post Office and R.N.L.I.

results.title: The Coast: a question of balance
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development, Dept of the Navy and David Hughes
results.brief_description: Filmed on location at Mornington Peninsula, Bellarine Peninsula, Apollo Bay, Torquay, Westernport Bay and Port Melbourne, this film is designed to alert students to the conflict inherent in man’s use of the coastal system, potentially one of the most fragile of environments. Shows the abuse of the sand dune systems through leisure, sport, traffic and the erection of structures, as well as the heavy demands placed by industry and shipping on coastal waters. Stresses that these competing interests will, if left unchecked, ultimately destroy the delicate flora and fauna balance of the coastal system. Music performed by Pink Floyd - “Be careful with that axe, Eugene” Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Coal question
results.creator_credit: CSIRO, Nicholas Alexander and Tony Chenn
results.brief_description: There are many questions raised about how coal, Australia’s major export earner, can be used most effectively and most responsibly. This film looks at the role of science in confronting these questions and describes the efforts and results of researchers in areas such as mine safety, coal to oil conversion and pollution control systems.

results.title: The Clue according to Sherlock Holmes
results.brief_description: A short film made for television of mystery and adventure and the search for buried treasure. Play detective, along with Sherlock Holmes (Keith McConnell) and Dr Watson (Laurie Main) as your hosts and follow ten year old Anthony Monday (Keith Mitchell and his friend Miss Ells (Dody Goodman) as they search for clues which will lead them to the buried fortune left behind by Alpheus T. Winterborn when he died. Cast also includes Louis Guss, Art Kassal, Hale Porter.

results.title: The Clubhouse boat
results.brief_description: This film tells of the plight of some young boys whose desire to purchase a boat leads them to commit misdemeanours in order to collect sufficient funds. The story explores the conflicts of loyalty and honesty that arise in the various situations experienced by individuals in the group in their attempts to find cash in a hurry. The story deliberately has no ending so that audiences can make up their own choices and decisions for an appropriate ending.

results.title: The Club
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, New South Wales Film Corporation, Matt Carroll, Bruce Beresford and David Williamson
results.brief_description: Laurie Holden (Jack Thompson) is coach of a Victorian Football League (VFL) team that hasn’t won a premiership for 19 years. Club president Ted Parker (Graham Kennedy) brings in a star recruit at great expense, but youngster Geoff Hayward (John Howard) is a major disappointment. As the club loses a string of games, the coach, president, committee members and players start to tear each other apart. Synopsis source: Australian Screen.
